questions.question_text:
SERVEROUTPUT is enabled.
Which is the correct method to use a PACKAGED CONSTANT in SELECT statements?
Which three are true about the procedure overloading feature? (Choose three.)

choices.C: Each procedure must use named notation to specify the corresponding actual parameters.
choices.A: Each procedure can be a nested subprogram.
choices.F: Each procedure must use positional notation to specify the corresponding actual parameters.
choices.B: Each procedure's formal parameters can differ in data type or name.
choices.G: Each procedure can be a standalone subprogram.
choices.E: Each procedure can be a packaged subprogram.
choices.D: Each procedure's formal parameters must differ in name.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BEG
B & E are easy to figure out.
Since the question clearly asks about overloading subprogram, the third answer is G.
Oracle documentation clearly states that each subprogram can be it' s own package.
A is right but not in the context of overloading subprograms.

Selected Answer: ABE
ABE - verified via Oracle documentation

Selected Answer: ABE
reviewed documentation

B. Each procedure's formal parameters can differ in data type or name.

comments.content:
F is wrong.

If formal parameters differ only in name, then you must use named notation to specify the corresponding actual parameters.

ABE is correct

G is wrong.
